article_title: Under Obamacare, Competition Is Costly For Consumers

article_metadata.author: Peter Ubel

og.description: Normally, market competition is good for consumers. More competition generally means competitors are battling each other to lower their prices and/or raise the quality of their goods. But when it comes to Obamacare, the market is working backwards, at least for people receiving health insurance subsidies through the exchanges. The [...]
